H0.text: Matter is made of elements is the discovery that the microscope was used to make, underscoring the microscope’s importance to the advancement of science and its role in enabling many other discoveries.

H1.text: Plants can make their own food is the discovery that the microscope was used to make, following the invention of the microscope—which was important to the advancement of science and enabled many other discoveries.

H2.text: Some organisms have only one cell is the discovery that the microscope helped make, highlighting the microscope’s importance to the advancement of science and its role in enabling many other discoveries.

H3.text: White light can be broken into colors is the discovery that was made possible by the microscope, highlighting the microscope’s importance to scientific advancement and the many other discoveries it enabled.

A4.text: Van Leeuwenhoek was one of the first people to observe cells, much like Robert Hooke.
